review.title: Nice hotel at the center of the city
review.reviewText: It was a good experience overall.  The room I had was a corner room, which meant more natural light.  It was very close to Union Square, which meant it was close to all the shops you would ever need.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location
review.negativeRemarks: Could use a little bit more cool air from the A/C and perhaps brighter warm lights from the lamp fixtures.

review.title: near union sq
review.reviewText: we were disappointed to be able to hear our neighbour cough cos the walls were thin and there was an interconnecting door between the rooms.   The wooden floors also added to the disturbance from late night guests.The bath fittings could have been of better quality so that the hot water can be adjusted better.
review.positiveRemarks:
The location was ideal being near the shops, restaurants, theatre and Power St station.
The beds were extremely comfortable.

review.title: San Francisco nights. And days.
review.reviewText: Excellent location (anyone can find the G-spot after all...), great older-style room (ie high ceilings, windows you can open). Close to everything - well, Union Sq/Powell St/Market St so public transport to get anywhere in SF, and there's a lot to get to. We loved it. Special mention to JR at reception!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location only a couple of minutes from union square and Powell street trolley stops. Made getting around the city to see all the sights very comfortable. Good shops and eateries around as well.

review.title: Nice hotel in a brilliant location
review.reviewText: The hotel is well located and the room was nice. Though the hotel facilities are a little basic - it's not that big a hotel after all - the staff where really friendly and helpful. The room itself was well equipped and the bed was comfy, and it was a reasonable size (certainly compared to most European hotels at least). I'd certainly stay here again, and some of this is because of the location which is right in the middle of San Francisco, just down the street from Union Square and about 5 minutes from one of the main MUNI/Bart stations.
review.positiveRemarks: Well located, nice room, and nice staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much you can do about it, but the central location does mean it can be a little noisy at times (might near earplugs if you're a light sleeper).
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of San Francisco. Loads of shopping nearby, and the MUNI/Bart station about 5 minutes walk away make it easy to get to most places

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText: Enjoyed stay.  Very central and walkable location to Union Square, shops, restaurants and sightseeing.

We greatly enjoyed staying at this hotel, but it felt as if some of the staff weren't trained on the amenities of the hotel. Ordering a ginger ale from room service seemed to be something that wasn't often requested as concierge didn't know who to call, request this from, or how to complete this order.

review.title: No floor coverings, loud, shower not adjustable.
review.reviewText: We would not go there again. 2 stars max. I have nothing more to say.

review.title: Central hotel with excellent restaurant
review.reviewText: Hotel G is right round the corner from the more famous Westin St. Francis, but cheaper, more stylish and with a better bar and restaurant.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the shabby chic decor, and found the bedroom comfortable and the bathroom reasonably sized. Laundry was done within the day.
review.negativeRemarks: The only downside was the gloomy reception, but better lighting could change that.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, just off the cable car route, near the BART station and a block away from the excellent San Francisco Playhouse.

review.title: Flash back to the hotel Savoy but New!
review.reviewText: for me this was a flash back to the 1980's when I used to stay at this location formerly known as the Hotel Savoy.  The cool think is they have left behind some relics of the past but new modern convenances.  Loved the mini expresso machine.  We have the same model at home.  The rooms are basic yet quite comfortable.  Shop for the rates on this hotel and be sure to check out the wine bar and restaurant next door.  YUM.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for Union Square and all SF locations via public transportation or cable car.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to everything
review.reviewText: Room was clean, pillows were a little flat, could be brighter. Very close to shopping, food, attractions. Short uber ride to everything.
Very Clean hotel, perfectly sized room with large TV. Great bathroom with walk in shower and automatic lights. Had airconditioning/heating in my room. Would definitely recommend.

review.title: Great location but tiny rooms unless you upgrade
review.reviewText:
We wanted a centralized location and a quiet stay for our family.
The hotel location and staff are great. 
We booked through Expedia, and received a tiny room with a view of the dirty inner portion of the building (not pleasant). It is worth it to upgrade the room for the extra space.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and staff are great.
review.negativeRemarks: The housekeeping services were inconsistent - toiletries weren't refilled and we didn't get enough towels for the number of people in our room

review.title: Nice, hip hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel G. Close to many restaurants, shops and stores. Hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating.

review.title: Nice hotel excellent location and friendly staff
review.reviewText: Really good, excellent location. Room was clean and quite big. Complimentary WiFi was a definite plus for me!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
Good deal. Close to BART transit from airport. Central and stores close by. Diners for breakfast across the street.
Downside= we are not accustomed to have such a large number of homeless and mentally/chemically affected individuals in our surroundings. We feel for them, but the environment can be intimidating. 
The hotel staff was very helpful and made up for all the negative aspects above.

Still, I would recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and staff. Great beds!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: How can we affect social issues !!!??
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, see above, close to Powell street access to cable car.

review.title: Awesome + Modern
review.reviewText: It was clean, comfortable, super stylish, and in close proximity to a lot of interesting things.

review.title: Updated hotel with historic bones
review.reviewText: Great location near Union Square. Super-friendly staff. Lots of early 1900s elements in the rooms and common areas: small tile, high ceilings, painted floor boards. Would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Nice hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Hotel is nice, clean, upbeat, hip. Very comfortable and very well located near restaurants and shopping.

review.title: hipster vibe very close to union square
review.reviewText: Awesome decor - really loved the hipster vibe. Nice small touches. Super close to union square. The wine bar downstairs is great!

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Very clean and trendy hotel conveniently located to public transportation, shopping and most sight seeing locations..

review.title: Good mixture of old hotel and modern convenience
review.reviewText: I liked that the hotel was small and revealed its age, while having modern facilities in the room.  The bathroom was especially comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Some type of heating in the bathroom.

review.title: Good location, close to public transit
review.reviewText: My cousin and I stayed four nights and although we didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel it was a good place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel G is very well-located in Union Square, close to a cable car stop, the metro and BART train station, and bus stops.
review.negativeRemarks: The pillows were a bit too soft for my taste and I wish that the shower head wasn't so close to the wall and was adjustable.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping in Union Square. But beware of the Tenderloin on the other side of Mason Street. It's a grim area.

review.title: Hotel In the City
review.reviewText: It was a wonderful hotel with friendly staff and clean rooms. It definitely was no 5 star show but I would return and stay there without hesitation.
review.positiveRemarks: The friendly and knowledgeable staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom counter space.
review.locationRemarks: Location is riight by union square with great food and easy transportation throughout the city.

review.title: Great location. Very trendy.
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed our stay at Hotel G. We had two rooms - one on the 3rd floor which had a great shower but was a bit smaller and unfortunately the toilet kept getting blocked. The second room was on the 10th floor and was much roomier with a couch. Extremely strong shower over the bath which leaked on the floor. Restaurant downstairs was great. Staff fabulous. Brilliant location for Union Square. Little bit noisy with local bands playing nearby. Best block out blinds I've ever come across! Being picky for this review but overall very happy.

review.title: Comfortable, old  hotel adjacent to Union Square
review.reviewText: Esthetically pleasing updated older facility in downtown area....our room was spacious, with a good bed and reasonable space for hanging clothing along with two drawers.....they included a Nescafe coffee & expresso maker, which also heated water for tea.....there was a big bathtub, an approximately 45 inch tv, and windows offering some city views .....a/c was there, but we didn't need it
review.positiveRemarks: Location was ideal for moving around the city....not too far from subway and muni.....gym
review.negativeRemarks: I was pleased with our stay....insulation between rooms is not particularly good (old space) but our neighbors were considerate
review.locationRemarks: Many restaurants, Union Square, about 30 minutes walk from Fisherman's Wharf and Embarcadero.....its central SF!

review.title: Great location, but loud street concerts
review.reviewText: Once we got our bearings in San Francisco, we really appreciated the central location to many of the great sites. Our only issue was the loud street concerts on Geary St. While they did die down into the night, the music was almost loud just for the sake of being loud. Overall, we were very happy with our choice.

review.title: hotel in heart of city, noisy
review.reviewText:
constant noise, couldn't sleep full nights.
location is almost too central.
good restaurant attached to hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: restaurant
review.negativeRemarks:
quietness. could hear everything outside and inside in hallways.
concrete floors do NOTHING for sound.

review.title: Union Square Hotel - City Central
review.reviewText:
Small boutique hotel in busy Union Square, the hotel is in an old converted office building.  
The hotel is decorated in line with the age of the building, there were some interesting artworks in our room.  The polished concrete floor made the room seem a bit cold.

The room included a shower over the bath, a small kitchen area with a Nespresso coffee machine and also had room for a table and three stools.

This hotel was great value for the money, central to everywhere, good public transport close by including access to the BART train at Powell Street Station.

The only downside was some street noise during the night and the limited view.

Would stay there again for a short stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location, close to transport.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise insulation.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of Union Square - close to restuarants, bars, shopping centres - buses nearby for Fisherman's Wharf, Japantown, Chinatown, etc.

review.reviewText: Good location  walking distance  to alot of things  cable cars shopping  food etc

review.title: Handy location for central area
review.reviewText:
I wanted a place close enough to the main tourist areas that I could walk if I wanted to. So I chose a place near Union Square. On that I achieved my aims with this hotel. 

However it doesn't have much in the way of facilities and feels very dated. The room was very dark and there was some street noise. 

However the staff at the front desk were very helpful and the servicing staff very efficient.

review.title: Cute Hotel, but loud
review.reviewText: Was on 7th floor and heard so much street noise. I am used to city noise as well (I live in New York). If you don't mind that, it is a cute and convenient hotel.

review.title: Three nights at the end of our holiday around CA
review.reviewText:
Amazing! Fab design, great use of space. Good quality furniture. Lovely comfy bed. Nice toiletries! 
Bathroom let it done only slightly as not so considered in design.
Corridors noisy.
Staff brilliant
Excellant location!

review.title: Nice rooms, friendly staff, lobby needs work
review.reviewText: Had a great experience, clean & big room, nice bathroom. Lobby & front desk area too small and could use some sprucing up. Overall, good hotel and would recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice room and spacious bathroom
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk & lobby could be improved

review.title: Authentic Cool
review.reviewText:
Cool, Spacious, Authentic, Apartment-Style base for exploring the city and relaxing in afterwards.
High ceiling rooms with a basic and comfortable vibe. Really loved the retained elements of the period building - it gave our stay good, memorable character. The staff were attentive and friendly and efficient. The bed was comfy, the shower good, the breakfast excellent. Would stay there again and definitely recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: The 1 lift for the 12 storey building was slow and broken. But was being fixed. Parking in SF is ££££!!! Advance warning would be appreciated.
review.locationRemarks: Right on the corner of union sq. Was handy for all the neighbourhoods we wanted to check out, by open top bus, tram by foot and cab.

review.title: Nice mid-range hotel in heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: We were looking for something centrally located in San Francisco, making it easier to see all the sites while having plenty of options for dining and shopping.  Hotel G fit the bill perfectly.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, 1 block from the trolly line.  Decor was cute - nice but not over the top.  Friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, really.  Rooms are small, but since it was just my husband and I, it was fine.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of dining and shopping within a couple blocks.  Easy access to public transportation.

review.reviewText:
Definitely not your cookie cutter hotel-it is a boutique hotel. Very clean,comfortable,and welcoming. A wonderful job in renovations and keeping some things from a100 years ago.
We really enjoyed the 3 night stay.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great,close to cable cars, Chinatown ,& plenty of dining facilities

review.title: Funky little hotel in excellent position
review.reviewText: This is a real cool boutique style hotel, old historic building, renovated really tastefully modern and stylish. Rooms are small but perfect for an inner city stay. Easy access to most places. Staff were friendly and helpful too. I fully recommend Hotel G.

review.title: Hotel G - 7/1-7/5/16
review.reviewText:
Super cool staff. Attentive; they made you feel valued as a guest.
Primo location. 1 block away from union square, 3 blocks from the BART station. For a tourist, this is a great central point for such a walkable city as San Fran. You're a few minutes from a lot of cool stuff, or at least access points. Hotel is right in the middle of the shopper's row, 5-10 minute walk from Chinatown; I could go on about the location.
Amenities were pretty nice. If you're looking for an uber-spacious place, then move on to the Ritz-Carlton. The rooms are cozy and comfortable. The hallways/elevators had a rustic feel to them, which, in my mind, let me know this building has some history behind it. All-wood floors, so if you don't like creaky floors then be advised. All-in-all, the rooms were clean, cozy, and great for an on-the-go tourist. When you needed to come in from your long day of walking & spending money, your room awaits for some TV watching, and winding down. The only "con" I could bring up about this place is that 1/2 elevators was out of service for the last 2 days of the trip, so taking it to the 7th floor took a bit longer than you'd want to hope; even then, it wasn't a big deal for me...take the stairs and problem solved!

Take-aways: Very cool room layouts; workout room small, but effective use of space (chic); clean; comfy beds; in-room fridge; nice sized TV; accessible to everything; super friendly staff
review.positiveRemarks: Cozy beds, hotel staff, location, cleanliness, cool hotel decor (boutique/modern/rustic blend)
review.locationRemarks: BART terminal a few blocks away, trendy shopping right outside your door, restaurants all over, Chinatown 5-10 minutes away, Cable Car

review.title: Work day stay
review.reviewText: I was only at Hotel G for 1night, however I found the Hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean, cool and quite.

review.title: Room
review.reviewText: The room was ok, except that the mattress was old and uncomfortable  There was a "mountain \" in the middle what made it really bad.  After the second night we had lower back pain because of the odd position of our bodies.  Hotel staff was not friendly at all.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Renew mattresses

review.title: Stylish and very comfortable
review.reviewText: A good-looking and very comfortable hotel. We stayed for three nights and the bed was so comfortable we found it very hard to leave it! Really stylish rooms, super-comfortable towels and bed linen and lovely toiletries. Staff helpful and rooms kept very clean. Dangerously good black-out blinds and sound proofing - we didn't hear the jackhammers on the crossing until we left the hotel! We didn't eat there but there are a couple of great breakfast options (Pinewood Diner across the crossing and David's Diner a couple of blocks west on Geary St). Great location to roam all over.
review.positiveRemarks: Super comfy beds, bed linen, stylish design felt special, room well-proofed against noise and light.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide complimentary water in the rooms; that's it.

review.title: great location, eh room
review.reviewText: Location was great but hotel was old and dated.  Our room was dark and on the inner "courtyard".  We had  almost no natural light from the one small window and the room lighting was sub-par. It was so dark in the bathroom that I had a hard time putting on make-up and was unable to read in bed due to the dim bedside light.  The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean.
review.positiveRemarks: location, bed
review.negativeRemarks:
LIGHTS!
paint the walls a warmer color

review.title: Very nice boutique hotel!
review.reviewText: Perfect location. Good balance price-quality-service. I would definetly go  back and recommended!
review.positiveRemarks: location. Staff. Cleannes. .
review.negativeRemarks: verry small closet space
review.locationRemarks: Everything nearby. Very secure at night

review.reviewText: An OK hotel - well situated close to Union Square and other attractions.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: I have checked pictures of the hotel online, but seeing it was quite interesting, you can expect some sort of avant-garde design, really unique and interesting, in some areas it may look a bit old and overused, but the rooms are well designed with nice details, Hotel G has its own personality!  it is very well located, street noise may be an issue, but not unbearable.  Definitely one to try
review.positiveRemarks: Uniqueness, design
review.negativeRemarks: except for David (reception desk), staff may have the San Francisco attitude you can skip
review.locationRemarks: One block from Union Square, accessible, close to lots of shopping, cable car, multiple restaurants

review.title: Modern hipster hotel in the heart of San Fran
review.reviewText: Hotel G - a winner. So two weeks ago I decided I wanted to go
review.positiveRemarks: It was very clean and modern!
review.negativeRemarks: The floors are a bit squeaky.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is about a block or two away, and Chinatown isn't very far either!

review.title: Great boutique hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Close to shopping, dining, and transit. Hotel G was a terrific find in the heart of SF
review.positiveRemarks: Great design. Friendly staff. Awesome location.
review.negativeRemarks: Lots of street noise. We are use to it, so didn't bother us, but it was noticeable.
review.locationRemarks: We enjoyed the quick walk to transit options and dining at Kin Khao nearby.

review.title: Quiet Comfy Unassuming Hotel
review.reviewText: good experience overall. good staff, helpful with everything.  very clean rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: location within the city. very comfy bed. great shower pressure
review.negativeRemarks: more drink options in the fridge
review.locationRemarks: good bars - esp one in hotel Benjamin Cooper. really good drinks

review.reviewText: Very trendy and comfortable. Great facilities and surroundings.

review.title: Great hotel in heart of union square
review.reviewText:
Wonderful boutique hotel in the heart of union square. The rooms were extremely comfortable and well decorated. The staff was very friendly and I was upgraded upon my
Arrival, which was a wonderful surprise.

review.title: right in the center of everything
review.reviewText: Hotel G was a wonderful hotel I had called the day before and let them know we would be early and when we got there our room was ready. The staff were incredibly  helpful they did everything from telling us how to get somewhere to downloading our return plane tickets. I would definitely stay there again.  The only reason I gave the facilities a 4 is we had a little trouble with the shower it was really hard to work.
review.positiveRemarks: where it was located, the cleanliness, the staff, and the room was really comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: shower
review.locationRemarks: it was centrally located.  Both my husband and I had a list of things we wanted to see and we were able to see them all.

review.title: Hotel with charm
review.reviewText: Very nice and clean hotel that is right in the middle of all the excitement! Great hotel to stay at!

review.title: Good for location and price
review.reviewText: Convenient location. Tons of shops and right by Powell street for cable cars. Just like Manhattan unfortunately very touristy  and lots of homeless people. Rooms are very industrial looking with unique artwork for purchase. I especially liked the bird wallpaper. Water pressure is a little intense in shower. The towels are very tiny. Enjoyed the Bigelow toiletries. Beds are comfy. Overall a nice stay in San Fran

review.title: Nice boutique hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Arrived early and staff able to hold our luggage while we got to explore Union Square. First night they were working on the hot water & gave notices to the guests. Didn't mind at all. Got the queen sized bed & room was bigger than expected! Bed was so comfy. Bathroom huge! Toiletries had a sexy manly scent- great for my hubby ;) Robes were fun. We didn't have a view but our room was quiet which was nice to sleep in. Restaurant next to the hotel a plus. Staff very friendly & helpful. Will definitely come back!

review.title: Great hotel walking distance to Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful. The staff was friendly and helpful!

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: It was half a block from union square and everything was so accessible. The bed was super comfortable and the room was very clean. Just the right size and very cute. The staff was great too; the best experience I've had in San Francisco
This was a very nice hotel in a great location.  I would stay here again.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: The G is a block from Union Square and is surrounded by restaurants and stores. It is the epitome of old school cool yet doesn't take itself too seriously. Good for the business traveller and tourist alike.

review.title: Meh.
review.reviewText: Hipster hotel with vintage charm in a central location. Not much else to write home about.  (A gift shop selling branded merchandise in the lobby does not count as an amenity.)

The hotel staff was very friendly, checked us in early on a day they were sold out. Located in the middle of union square and on the corner of Mason/Geary so it was really convenient to get around. Don't park at the hotel they charge $50-60 a night, park at the O'Farrell parking garage and walk over (not too far). The room was clean, I liked the bathroom setup and the decor of the room. I was hoping that the room was a little bigger, stayed on the 7th floor and looked out onto the street. it was a really nice room, just thought because of their photos it would be a little more spacious.

review.title: Comfy hotel in the middle
review.reviewText:
Very comfy hotel and its location is very nice.
Free nespresso capsules are also helpful to enjoy San Francisco.But there is no free water.
It could be little bit noisy because it is located in the center of Union Square. But it's not a big deal.
Heater is okay, but sounds big noisy and little bit smelly.
Overally,it's a nice hotel for enjoying 4nights here.

review.title: Loud Hotel
review.reviewText: I was put in this hotel after Expedia cancelled my pre-paid reservation at another hotel. This hotel was extremely loud and not at all worth the price of what was charged at the end. You heard everything that went on in the hotel during all hours of the night due to the floors and doors. Didn't get a sound sleep for the two days I stayed.
review.positiveRemarks: I didn't care for anything at this hotel. Nothing stuck out to me to make me comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything! The restaurant didn't open when it said it was supposed to open and the noise at this hotel was awful.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, just wouldn't recommend the hotel to others.

review.title: Good affordable option in great area
review.reviewText:
I stayed in this hotel for a business trip March 2016. The area can't be beat - minutes away from Union Square shopping, close to public transport (Bart & Metra) and Moscone Center. Also a short cab/uber from the rest of SF (I actually walked one day from North Beach to the hotel and it was fine). 
The hotel itself is nice. Keep in mind, this is an old building. The elevators are a bit slow and the walls are slightly thin (I could hear every move the housekeepers made in the morning). If you are a light sleeper it's probably not for you, although they do provide earplugs. My room was furnished in that sort of rustic hipster chic that is all the rage - I was comfortable, but it's not richly appointed by any means. I thought the amenities/price ratio was very good. I enjoyed the free Nespresso every morning. Bathroom was more than comfortable with nice CO Bigelow products.  There's a small gym, good wifi and the 389 restaurant next door had an excellent Lyonnaise salad. All in all, I was very happy with what I got for the very reasonable price I paid.
review.positiveRemarks: In-room amenities - Nespresso maker, bathroom products, snack selection. Availability of gym. Location was fantastic.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise level is high but that really can't be helped due to the age of the building.
review.locationRemarks: Less than 5 minutes to Union Square - tons of shopping, restaurants and bars. Quick walk to public transport on Bart & Metra.

review.title: Good location. Friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Place was ok. Its a 3 star not 4. Room was a bit small and walls are very thin - i could hear normal conversation from next room so not much privacy. I knew all this going in so no surprises. I chose it for the location. But I eventually moved to nearby hotel for better privacy.

review.title: 3 Dressed Up as a 9 - But I'd Still Come Back!
review.reviewText:
Ok...This is a 4 star rated facility, but it really should be rated a 3 star.  This is a really old hotel.  The floors are really squeaky!  They were so squeaky that I was afraid that I might wake up guests in the neighbouring rooms (because I'm a night owl!).  So this leads to my biggest complaint about this hotel; you can hear right into the next guest room clear as if there were no wall between you.  My room had the locked doorway between adjoining rooms, and I could hear my neighbour VERY easily.  I could hear his telephone conversation like he was in the same room as me;  I could also hear him snoring at night.  No doubt the hotel is very aware of this since they provide you with earplugs.

One of the bonuses of the room was the very fashionable interior decor;  walnut furnishings of very high quality....very nice apron styled sink with oiled bronze faucet.....stunning bathroom tiling work (in very new condition I might add)....These were just a few of the really nice touches.

Location:  Amazing location...close to Powell Street and the cable cars.....right next to Union Square and the shopping district!  Tons of great restaurants!   This hotel is located right next to a 5 star hotel....so the location really can't be beat!  All the comments I had read previously about it being a lousy neighbourhood....?  Ignore those comments....If you're a bit nervous, take Powell street back to the hotel when walking back... Really location is amazing and I felt really safe!
review.positiveRemarks: AMAZING toilet!  You will NEVER need to be embarrassed to use a plunger at this hotel!  Rain Shower head is also a pure LUXURY! Drenches you in water!
review.negativeRemarks: Just the noise factor between rooms...needs work!  LOVED how the black out shades in the room kept the room in TOTAL darkness!
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, dining out, shopping, street cars, union square....Amazing location!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: It was a nice hotel near union square. It reminded me of a hostel on the inside. The noise from the laundry chute woke me up every morning. I could hear the room across the hall having a party at 3am and nothing was done about it. I hated that I couldn't open the window to get fresh air and I was allergic to the very loud air conditioning unit. I did like that they didn't charge me when I requested a 1hour extension on my check out time.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: For the price, I thought this would be a hotel similar to a Kimpton.  Unfortunately, not even close.  It was hard to get the temperature right, lighting was poor, there was almost no water pressure in the bathroom sink, and the desk chair was incredibly squeaky.

review.title: Close to all
review.reviewText: Close to all, clean rooms, friendly staff, free guest wifi!

review.title: so convient to shopping and to others interests.
review.reviewText: love this hotel, this is my 2nd time here, and i love it! only thing!!! is the door could be thicker, you can hear every time someone is in the hall.
review.positiveRemarks: the aestics of the place.
review.negativeRemarks: the lighting in the bathroom, and more plugs.
review.locationRemarks: love the location, close to shopping and transportation.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: It was really nice and the locAtion Is the best. Our room was a little noisy because it was on the side of a music hall or sth like that. The mattress was old, though. It definitely needed a change.

review.title: Very old building.  Loud!
review.reviewText: The hotel wasn't horrible by any means.  It had very comfortable beds.  It's old and feels old.  You can hear everything going on outside and in the halls.  The worst part is the rooms are very dark.  You couldn't even see yourself in the mirror.  My colleague said his room was the same.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed
review.negativeRemarks: The lighting and the floors in the main lobby.  Also room service closes at 10:30 and I think that's too early
review.locationRemarks: Very close to everything.  We took BART and it was within walking distance.

review.title: Nice clean room
review.reviewText: Our room had a window which opened into an air shaft. It was small but very clean (except for under the desk). The lighting was dim. This gave the room a cave like atmosphere.  The Nexpresso machine was great....a saving grace.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and friendly and accommodating staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Better lighting in the rooms.  Quieter air con. More insulation in the door.
review.locationRemarks: Lots to do. Union Square one block away.  Public buses at all corners.  Walking distance to millions of beautiful shops. Good food of all kinds.

review.title: So disappointing
review.reviewText: Overall, my experience with this hotel was awful. The first night I arrived, the room was freezing. It felt like I'd entered the Arctic Circle. There is zero insulation. I felt like I was staying in a hostel the first night. The walls are so thin you can literally hear everything in the adjoining rooms and in the hallways. I complained because we spent quite a bit for our room and I had a better experience at a HoJo than this place! They moved us to a nicer room upstairs but then, housekeeping didn't even clean our room. They made our bed. Dirty washcloths and towels were left in the room two days in a row, even after I spoke to the front desk about the situation. I definitely would suggest going to the Westin or JW Marriott around the corner. Do not stay here.

review.title: From paper-thinned wall to sound-proof retreat
review.reviewText: Check-in experience was not pleasant. It's 3pm and the room was not ready. While I was waiting, a lady requested room change due to noise. I emphasized that I needed a quiet room to work. Obviously, that was ignored. I could hear every conversation, music, TV from the adjacent room after 3 AM in the morning. On the second night, I moved out at 4:30AM. The front desk lady assisted with the move was super nice and provided me a bigger, quiet room for the subsequent 3 nights. I would not even know if other guests were around. So the first 2 nights deserved a score of 2 but the last 3 nights were 5-star! Bottom line: make sure to request a quiet room and hold them to their words.

Anyway, the location is aboslutly convenient (half block to Union Square) and the service / cleanes of the facilities is according to the price and usual standards in SF.

review.title: Sleepless in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Nice lobby, easy check in, friendly staff. 
Was expecting rooms to be light/modern/bright, however our room lacked natural light because the window opened up to another wall. 
Unforunately our room backed onto the elevator shaft, which was the main source of noise. Everytime the lift was in operation all we could hear was the clunking of the mechanisms and people getting in/out. It was noisy enough that the headboard of bed vibrated. 
We appreciate it was Halloween and hence the was slightly more noise, but the biggest problem is the lack of carpets on the hallway floors, and the gaps under the doors, it was just so loud. A bit of retro charm is fine, but I think this is to the detriment of the hotel quality. 
We don't cause a fuss easily, but it was enough to ask if any other rooms available, only a suite was available and that was $40 extra, which isn't a lot but I did feel the current room was so bad the hotel should have upgraded for free. 
It was the last night of our honeymoon, and from reading expedia reviews and the pictures I was genuinely excited - it looked like a nice well presented modern hotel. I was absolutely disapointed, it ruined our last night, I have slept better on public transport.  Maybe we had the worst room in the hotel, but I would rather spend a night in my car than risk this hotel again. 
On the upside, on the whole the staff we encountered were really friendly and eager to help - if anything they are let down by the hotel standards.

review.title: Pretty but didn't feel comfortable or welcome.
review.reviewText: The staff was unable to manage the volume of customers they had, which resulted in poor customer service. The bathroom was very small. The room was clean and pretty, but did not feel comfortable or luxurious.

Just returned home on Sept 13 from spending 6 nights at Hotel G while touring SF. The location is excellent, being very central to all manner of public transport. Was an easy BART ride between SFO and the Powell Street transit station, at the good 1-way price of $8.65 US. The first night, I was awoken by a bit of street/next door room noise but learned to accommodate that with a bit of white fan noise from there on out. Earplugs are provided too. I found the bed to be extremely comfortable. Bathtub was great for long soaks at the end of busy walking days. Everything was extremely clean. The front desk staff let us check into one of our two rooms upon arriving mid-morning and the second room shortly thereafter, well before the normal 3 pm check-in. I would definitely stay at Hotel G again and would highly recommend it. Great old hotel architecture with modern, hip interior design. Nice touch having in-room safes.

review.title: Clean Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: The staff were very friendly and accommodating getting us into our room early and keeping an eye on our luggage after checkout time. The room was very clean with a modern industrial look.They have kept some features of the original building in the lobby which while not totally attractive add to the authenticity of the hotel. The bed was very comfortable and the mini bar fridge allowed for keeping my soy milk at the hotel. A grocery store was about 1 1/2 blocks away. Any time we needed directions, the front desk knew where we wanted to go and how to get there. We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel G. Be aware that you are in the downtown core of San Francisco, so like any other big city core, you have the homeless wandering the streets, and you need to be cautious about where you carry your valuables. There is also sooo much shopping within one block it could make your head spin. All the high end stores like Sacs 5th Avenue surround Union Square, less than 1 block from the hotel.

The from dest staff was friendly and kind. The breakfast wasn't included in our package, We found the grocery market in Powell street, which served breakfast and variety of fruit salad and juices for a reasonable price.

I reserved a room on a higher floor and I was so happy to did that because the Hotel is located in a very busy street and it should be noisy in a lower floor rooms. 

Our room was spacious and the bed was the king size bed as i asked for and so comfortable and clean. but the design of the hotel and the room was so boring. everything was grey and white and it was like the foggy and boring rainy days! 
There are no carpet in the hallways and I could easily heard when neighbours were walking there. 

This hotel would be a good place to stay if anybody wish to sleep somewhere clean and close to sightseeings.

review.title: Nice hotel in Union Square part of downtown SF
review.reviewText:
Hotel G was part of a package deal with flights for a good price, so I booked it.  It said 4 stars and I generally agree with that rating.  The hotel was very nice and the remodeling they're doing makes it look very modern.  It was a great location, close to the BART stop from San Francisco Airport (3 blocks) and close to everything I wanted to see while in downtown.  The hotel bar had great drink selections and awesome bartenders (I didn't try the food there).  They held our bags all day Friday before our 4 PM check-in and then again all day Sunday before we flew out (so that we could sight see with just a backpack).  The gym was awesome with multiple cardio machines and a nice set of dumbbells (5-50 lbs.).

I did have a couple small complaints about the hotel though.  Our room was on the 3rd floor and they seem to still be remodeling the portion of the floor where our room was.  For example, the wood floors outside our door in the hallway as well as the floors inside our room creaked loudly when we walked on them.  This was an issue for me because I wake up earlier than my wife and go to the gym, and I try to sneak out of the room.  The creaking floors made that impossible.  Also, the shower took about ten minutes for the water to get up to warm/hot temperatures after turning it on.  This was slightly annoying.  Like I said, I agree with the 4 star rating, but they need to fix a couple of things to stay in that 4 star area.

More precisely, I would give this hotel 3.5 stars.  

We stayed at Hotel G for 4 nights and had a relatively good experience.  The staff with which we interacted was pleasant and helpful.  The room itself was small and there wasn't much space designated for your clothes/luggage.  Part of the floor was cement (about 1/4 of the room) and rest of area was carpeted.  You could tell that many aspects of the hotel are dated. However there are recent improvements, like the shower and bathroom area are new and tiled, and certain aspects of the hotel are definitely tech-modern, like the gym.  

I never got the sense that this was a hotel where you just want to check-in, stay and lounge.  Some reviewers complaining should've done their due diligence researching and found a hotel for 'beach-resort like relaxing' and not stayed here.  This was more of a comfortable hotel for sleep and dropping your stuff off while you mosey about and explore San Francisco, since the hotel is located in a very convenient location in Union Square (just don't walk east too far toward Tenderloin... a lot of 'aggressive' homeless people).  We barely spent any time at the hotel other than for sleeping and rest at the end of the day.  For this purpose, the hotel is great.

All in all, the price was fair for the city location and for the purpose I described.  I would return to this establishment.
review.positiveRemarks:
- Friendly staff
- Location
- Affordable price (relative to other hotels in area)
review.negativeRemarks:
- Certain dated aspects to the hotel
- Little room for clothes/luggage storage
