review.title: What a wonderful place to stay!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hotel G for 5 nights and had a super time.  The motel is a block from Union Square and the trolley cars.  The restaurants were really good, we ate at the Klyde Cafe and Wine Bar twice and had cocktails at the 398 Restaurant & Bar.  The food and prices were right inline with every other establishment.  The only difference was, the Hotel G in our opinion was so much better.  And I know we were having the complete experience of staying at the Hotel G and all but the staff is outstanding, rooms are very clean and the beds wonderful.  I would highly recommend this motel to anyone traveling to San Francisco and we will definitely be staying there again!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the cleanliness, the food was great and the pricing was inline with every other place.
review.negativeRemarks: If they could have another set of elevators but we never had any long waits so I am nit picking!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is close, Trolley Cars, Cheese Factory, Chinnatown is 3 blocks away, there is just so much to do within walking distance.

review.reviewText: Great location handy to Union Sqaure. Probably only a 3* but very clean and an extra point for location.

review.title: Nice staff, available every time and fast response
review.reviewText: Excellent staff and location, only problem are the noisy doors(slamming) during the night
Fantastic hotel. Friendly staff and great environment.

review.title: Nice Hotel, close to almost everything.
review.reviewText: Really I did not expect such a good hotel for the price we paid. Its location is convenient for shopping , restaurants or take a tour bus.
review.positiveRemarks: hotel cleanliness , comfort and well located.
review.negativeRemarks: The mattresses were too soft in my opinion . Otherwise everything was fine.
review.locationRemarks: Really I did not expect such a good hotel for the price we paid. Its location is convenient for shopping , restaurants or take a tour bus.

review.title: Boutique like hotel at Union Square in San Francis
review.reviewText: Convenient to many sightseeing spots, public transportation and shopping. No frills hotel. Would definitely stay there again. Price was right!!

review.title: Nice hotel, in the Downtown San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Everything was in walking distance.  Getting to the hotel via BART was easy, and no traffic to deal with.
review.positiveRemarks: Location.
review.negativeRemarks: The walls and door between the rooms and hall door could be better sound proofed.
review.locationRemarks: A block from the tour buses where you can get off & on as many times as you want.  Shopping, park, and Trolley stops.

review.title: Great location near Union Square
review.reviewText: Hotel front desk are very welcoming and extremely helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was perfect and the staff was terrific. The room was modern, updated and clean.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square and within walking distance of many stores, places to eat and attractions.

review.title: Great Hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: This was our first stay at Hotel G.  The staff are amazing and the room and bed were super comfortable.  Everything was top notch, from the coffee maker to the great shower.
review.positiveRemarks: This a a cool older building that has been renovated but still keeps a lot of it's old charm.  The location is top notch and the staff is great.
review.negativeRemarks: When you read reviews of this hotel, people complain about it being noisy.  We did not find it any more noisy than any other urban center hotel.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is one block from Union Square in San Francisco.  What else could you want.  You can watch the silly tourists line up for the cable car.

review.title: Happy traveler.
review.reviewText: Very friendly and helpful staff.  Ideally located.
review.positiveRemarks: Liked unique old style building with comfortable rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Make more sound proof from outside noise at night.
review.locationRemarks: Near shops, buses and everything is in walking distance. Lovely for people who like exploring.

review.title: NOT recommended
review.reviewText:
I would not recommend this hotel. 
The floors are unfinished with exposed concrete, there are no coffee makers in the rooms, and the showers were completely non-functional. This was like a motel with some fancy art on the walls.
review.positiveRemarks: The housekeeping staff was thorough, and our room did seem very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee in the rooms, a functional shower, actual flooring.
review.locationRemarks: It's in union square, which isn't exactly ideal unless you want to be in union square. It's very noisy 24/7. The hotel did provide ear plugs.

review.reviewText: Great location...central to everything.  Room was clean and cozy.

review.title: Convenient and boutique
review.reviewText: Well located and friendly staff. However, depending on what room you get can be chic boutique or small and dark. Recommend if staying for a short trip and not expecting extras.

review.title: Nice Hotel but not my cup of tea.
review.reviewText: I gave the boutique hotel thing a try and it's not for me. People were nice, room was clean but not my style.
review.positiveRemarks: People were nice, room was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Pool, bar
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located

review.title: Central location in Union Square
review.reviewText: Hotel G is located on Geary street just a block or two up from Union Square.  You're right in the middle of lots of shopping and it is an easy walk (maybe a mile) up to the Financial District and the Ferry Building.  The rooms are clean and neat, but not luxurious.  Great bathrobe, and the bathroom had been recently updated.  The staff is wonderful - kind and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: central location, but without the insane SF price
review.negativeRemarks: It can take their valet service 30-40 minutes to retrieve your car and get it to you. That isn't them being slow, it's the reality of SF traffic
review.locationRemarks: lots of high-end retail stores and art galleries.

review.title: Met our needs.
review.reviewText: Good experience overall. Enjoyed the service recieved but had wished the cleaning staff had started later in the morning...loudly knocking on doors and vacuuming at 8:00am in the morning didn't make for relaxing mornings.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location, helpful front desk staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning staff started every morning at 8:00am on our floor making it noisy and difficult to sleep in on our vacation.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping and cable cars.

review.title: In the city
review.reviewText: Very easy to get around or get a taxi. There is also a lot of restaurant nearby if you're hungry

review.title: Very clean and modern, great location!
review.reviewText: Fantastic location - right next to Union Square and opposite to the Pinecrest Diner. Very clean and modern room, huge comfortable bed, free WiFi, and friendly staff.

review.title: Good environment for traveling.
review.reviewText:
The Staff was great. I found those I encountered were honest, helpful, and informative. They rate a "10" as for as my experiences  with them.
I am retired and I travel to at least two holiday destinations (such as Washington DC) a year.
The only we missed was the breakfast. Apart from that it's fine for a city break.
review.negativeRemarks: Have breakfast.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Got  good deal on Expedia. Very close to Union Square but borders shady/homeless area in SF. Was very noisy at night so difficult to sleep. I probably wouldn't stay there again unless I couldn't find anything else in the price range as SF hotels are expensive!

review.title: Great time at Hotel G!
review.reviewText: Great location, elevator, staff, and comfy bed. Easy to walk to restaurants, lots to do, staff recommendations were excellent. Always a smile from everyone!
review.positiveRemarks: Location and staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are small, but that is San Fransisco. Surely not as small as NYC…lol
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, cable cars, the BART, shopping, restaurants, and more…

review.title: Why bother, when there are many better options?
review.reviewText: This is generally a nicely renovated boutique hotel in an excellent location.  There is a small fitness room with nice equipment, but it is a tight fit for the equipment and guests.  The rooms are small, which is to be expected, with nice towels and linens.  The bed is o.k., but not "heavenly."  Spartan fixtures:  hard wood chairs, a mirror propped against a wall.  The look grows on you; I didn't miss the usual hotel wall "art" or the carpeting.  I was not happy that a $75 charge was placed on my credit card, to be credited back if there were no incidental expenses.  No other hotel has done this.  The room bathrobes were missing:  will I be charged for these?
review.positiveRemarks: The best thing about the hotel is the location, steps from Union Square and public transit.
review.negativeRemarks: The poor lighting in the room is ridiculous!  The $75 mandatory "credit" against your credit card is a Ponzi scam.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to all of S.F. central attractions and easily connects to anywhere in the Bay Area.

review.reviewText: Great location. Tastefully decorated. Would definitely stay here next time I'm in San Francisco.

review.title: Boutique Hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Great smaller hotel a very short walk from Union Square and centrally located near many attractions! You definitely can hear the noise of the street below, however it didn't harm our stay at all. Friendly and accommodating staff. Mid-Size room with plenty of space, nice decor, and clean! The walk in shower has no door and really gets a lot of water all over the floor in the bathroom. Overall great hotel and would gladly stay again!
Nice hotel for the price.  Street noise a little loud.
Nice cozy rooms in a quaint "ageing" style decor for the hotel. Great location @ Union Square! We enjoyed our stay here.

review.title: Retro-cool and Upscale Without Being Snooty.
review.reviewText: Check-in was a breeze. Was able to visit all of the places I wanted to see and come back to a super-comfortable, clean bed with a view of the city. Staff was the best, really went the extra mile. Great central locale (just avoid the Tenderloin unfortunately). Uber rides are cheap around the City and there are plentiful car rental options if you want to head out and explore wine country. Wonderful experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Retro-cool and clean. Great service. Helpful and friendly staff, I mean really, they treated us like family… in a good way!
review.negativeRemarks: Would advise guests to avoid the Tenderloin if possible. Foreigners might especially benefit from this info. Area needs major help.
review.locationRemarks: Great food downstairs if you want to stay close. Near Union Square and a quick Uber ride to the waterfront. Lots of rental car options nearby.

review.reviewText: Room was clean and nicely laid out.  It was very hard for me to sleep though due to all the noise from the street and from the hallway.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise both from hallway and outside.

review.title: Excellent location.
review.reviewText: Super location. Perfect room size. Staff very friendly (desk agents, doorman, housekeeping). Internet worked well after getting special sign in codes. Room in front geary street not noisy at all. In room coffee not good at all ,we tried one night very late, but SF has delicious coffee places all around (like "La Taza" on Post st ,one and half block away from the hotel with super cheap breakfast and good portions). I wil,definetly stay at this hotel every year as long they maintain the same quality ( They only need to clean the lobby rugs  ).
review.positiveRemarks: All
review.negativeRemarks: They only need to clean the lobby rugs.
review.locationRemarks: One block away of Union Square, what else can you ask!

review.title: Central Hotel with friendly staff
review.reviewText: Hotel G is only a minute from Union Square and is quite close to the Westfield Shopping Centre. The hotel still has the unique old-style feel while still being very updated. The rooms are a decent size as well - my only complaint would be that there is no overhead light in the bedroom or bathroom, so I found it a bit dark. The staff are friendly and helpful with bar/restaurant suggestions.  If you're travelling alone and looking for somewhere to mingle and meet people, I highly suggest the Golden Gate Tap Room on Powell Street. There's skee ball, pool, shuffle board etc. and  a friendly atmosphere. I also really enjoyed the Three 9 Eight restaurant (the parisian breakfast is mt favourite especially if you are in a hurry) and Roy was a friendly, attentive, and excellent server. Be careful walking west past Mason St in the Tenderloin - there are lots of homeless people in the area. Overall, a great hotel I would definitely stay at again!
review.positiveRemarks: The biggest perks to this hotel are its location, the friendly staff, and its old-timey yet updated feel.
review.negativeRemarks: Overhead lights in the bedroom and bathroom
review.locationRemarks: I'd definitely recommend the hop on hop off bus tour with Big Bus tours - a great way to see all the highlights! Also fisherman's wharf & pier 39

review.title: First Time in San Francisco, CA
review.reviewText: Hotel G is different from other hotels I've stayed in. It is an older building that is being updated. there is no carpet on the floor which lends to the volume of noise of things being dropped.  The room is pretty small compared to newer buildings. If you need a clean, comfortable sleep and you are not planning on spending a lot of time in the room, Hotel G is a nice place to stay. I would stay there again, and I would recommend it to others.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was close to everything. The staff was pleasant and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Improvement should be made to the shower stalls. Water leaks around the door.
review.locationRemarks: The Hotel is walking distance to upscale shopping, and transportation. Catch the trolley to Fisherman's Warf and Pier 39.

review.title: Excellent location in Union Square
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay and hotel location is very central to shopping and dining. Excellent customer service; very comfortable bed.

review.title: Modern, close to everything, Perfect City hotel.
review.reviewText: Hotel G was close to everything yet just around the corner of Union Squar to avoid the crazy tourists. Loved the room, the decor and had a great restaurant and wine bar flacking each side of it. Staff were great, price was great.
Wooden floors in the hallway make it a little noisey if you are near the elevator.

review.title: Lovely staff and room. Thanks.
review.reviewText: Could be a bit quieter. I was impressed at how quickly little issues were addressed.  Great bed and great coffee maker.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, room.
review.negativeRemarks: A little noisy.
review.locationRemarks: Near union square, galleries, public transportation.

review.reviewText: Really enjoyed my 4 night stays. Hotel is quiet and bed was very comfortable.

review.title: Very nice hotel, close to transportation and shops
review.reviewText: Recently booked our trip to San Francisco and didn't want to spend too much on boarding. Our Hotel G experience exceeded all expectations. Room was clean, bed/pillows were very comfortable, excellent staff! Location was convenient to public transportations, shopping malls, and restaurants. We'll definitely come back to Hotel G if given the opportunity.
review.positiveRemarks: Expedia

review.title: That Bed!
review.reviewText:
That bed was ridiculously amazing!
It made me want to stay in bed all day and not explore SF!

review.title: Best Location!
review.reviewText: Awesome stay! The location is so good, room is clean, bed is super comfy and the staffs are all helpful & friendly

review.title: I would stay here again !
review.reviewText: This was a really good location if you want to be close to all the shopping etc in Union Square. Staff was very helpful and nice. Linens are great, the towels are soft and plush, I wanted to take the bathrobe home! The bed is also very comfortable, slept very well. Two things I disliked - very small bathroom with minimal space to leave toiletries and non carpeted floor that was almost industrial looking and hard. While there was a carpet around the bed, the rest of the floor was bare. The bathroom however was new with a powerful shower so that compensated for the small size. We booked a great king which is pretty large compared to their standard ones.

review.title: Minimalistic offerings
review.reviewText:
The room was cold and cement floor.  Terrible lighting in the bathroom.  Staff was friendly.  Hotel bar was small and didn't have much to offer for happy hour specials.  You will want to go somewhere else to relax and have something to eat/drink.  
Hotel is still under construction/renos.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for our first visit to San Fran for 3 nights. I primarily booked this hotel because of the location. The location is PERFECT, but also there is a lot of character to this hotel as well. Everything was clean and the bed was incredibility comfortable. The hotel is steps away from Union Square, the BART transit and the Cable cars as well; if you do the hop on hop off bus there is a stop a block away. The cab ride to Fisherman's Wharf/Alcatraz landing is only about a $10 cab ride away too. The hotel is beside tons of places to go out to eat, drink and shop. We went to the restaurant attached to the hotel for breakfast and the food was delicious. If you want a hotel that is comfortable and in the prime location I would highly recommend booking with Hotel G - we would certainly stay here again and again.
review.positiveRemarks: Character, location
review.locationRemarks: Shop, eat, Dine, Transit

review.reviewText:
Fantastic experience. Exceptionally clean, in particular the bathroom. The linen provided was also of a high quality along with he bathroom amenities. Mini bar was also very well priced. Internet access was also very fast for a complimentary service. 

The two restaurants are both also very good. 

Overall an excellent stay and I would return.

review.title: Great location, hotel more style than substance
review.reviewText:
We spent 3 nights at the hotel. It's located just off Union Square which is perfect for the main shopping areas, and the tram on Powell St. the location worked well for us an wasn't noisy even on Friday/Saturday night. 
The hotel has a modern, urban style. The hotel appears relatively new so retains a clean appearance. It is a little style over substance though, plug socket covers were lose in the wall in our room, and the ceiling lamps that hang down next to the bed swing alarmingly when you pull the chain. Things like this make it seem like it was rushed and not of a great quality. 
We booked the entry level room which was small but in that respect I think it reflects what we payed. The bed was comfortable, nice linens and pillows but was pretty small for a double which made for a poorer nights sleep. I think again reflective of the entry level room we had no view other than an external metal staircase from the window. 
Lighting isn't great in the rooms, again I think this is due to the rooms styling, but it can be a bit frustrating when getting ready. 
The bathroom was nicely styled but the shower was weak, you didn't quite have to run around to get wet but it not far off that. We also 2-3 times had a smell of sewage in our bathroom. 
The hotels gym is small but modern and clean. 
We didn't try the adjoined restaurant but it looked pretty nice. 
Overall I wouldn't stay again , I suspect there are better hotels for the price.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Room fittings e.g shower, lighting etc
review.locationRemarks:
Trams on Powell St, these will take you to the fishermans wharf for Alcatraz etc 
Shopping at union square

review.reviewText: Great stay... A little loud from the street but note that is expected in large cities. I loved this chic hotel. Would stay again

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText: Great hotel! Right off Union Square, however not as noisy as you may think. Concrete floors and retro furniture keep it minimal but very comfortable. Greatest King room great for sleeping and chilling out. Small bathroom, but shower pressure made up for that. Washrooms on 1st floor beautifully done. Didn't use the gym however great equipment. Would highly recommend and would look to stay again. Klyde wine bar next door open after 4 is nice spot for a drink and quick bite. 368 restaurant on other side was disappointing on day 2 for breakfast; appears couldn't cope with volume.  Luckily great bar around corner on Powell that sold fresh juice and fresh pastries. Ask about Italian on Ellis, sorry forgot the name, however food well worth it! Overall look forward to another stay.

review.title: Nice hotel near to Union Square
review.reviewText: My room was clean and my King size bed was very comfy.

review.title: G Unit!
review.reviewText: Great experience, staff were great - nice gym, rooms were great too - clean, and well designed. Call it "boutique" or whatever - the price was great - just a block from Union Square.  Would definately return.
review.positiveRemarks: Room, Gym, Location, staff

review.reviewText: Great location,friendly staff and very comfy bed and pillows.

review.title: Nice Hotel, But Noisy.
review.reviewText: This was our first time at Hotel G.  We got a combo deal with flight through Expedia.  We came to San Francisco for our anniversary.  The hotel seems pretty old, but has been refurbished on the inside.  The elevators are small and quaint, but are efficient.  We never had to wait too long for one.  When we arrived, the concierge was friendly and immediately upgraded us to a King bed from a Queen.  The room was comfortable with plenty of space.  The bathroom was small, but adequate.  Everything was clean.  I swear that we could hear every word of the people in the next room as if they were in our room!  There is no sound dampening at all.  Also, during the night, we could hear much of the noise outside in the streets below.  You kind of get used to it and, I guess, that is the price you pay for staying in an older hotel without any sound dampening in the middle of downtown San Francisco.  On the other hand, Hotel G was within walking distance of everything we wanted to see in town so, overall, we were pleased with the facilities.  One final note... my wife told me she really liked Hotel G and would stay there again.  Believe me, my wife usually complains about her hotel stays, so this is awesome praise!
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were very comfortable and the hotel was conveniently close to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: You can hear every little noise in the next room as well as outside street noises.  They need some sound dampening put in.
review.locationRemarks: One block from the Hop On Hop Off bus tours.  3 blocks from picking up the cable car at Powell & Market. Walking distance to most entertainment.

review.title: Great hotel with great location.
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful 3 nights stay. The corner room was amazing with big windows. The high ceiling makes the room spacious. Bed was comfortable and the location was great. We had dinner at Klyde and it was a great meal. The maitre'd was very hospitable. He helped us chose our meal and they were delicious. We had found our new favourite hotel in San Francisco.

review.title: Downtown hotel
review.reviewText: Rooms were very small and noisy. Very expensive for what you get.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger lobby
review.locationRemarks: Good location.close to shopping and food.

review.title: Good option given the price
review.reviewText: This is an odd little hotel and I have to say it took me awhile to get into it, but in the end I came to like it. The impression of the hotel at the entrance is not great. The entrance area is crowded and dark and the elevator looks like something that should be transporting grain in a silo. However, the room was much better than the elevator. The decor is unusual. The pluses are the bed, which was phenomenally comfortable, and of course the price. The minuses are relatively minor, but include the shower (which was barely 4 inches across and lacked water pressure) and the lack of plugs for charging my various devices, and the fact that sometimes the cutesiness outweighed practicality (it took me 10 minutes to realize that he hair dryer was in the bag marked "BLOW"). I have mixed feelings about the lack of wall-to-wall carpet, but apart from making the floor creaky it wasn't uncomfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: It was a great price and was very close to the conference I was attending. Also, the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: You could work on the hotel entrance. First impressions are important!
review.locationRemarks: It's right near Union Square, just up the hill from the cable car turn-around, and near a bar (Pucinni's) with a happy hour with $3 beer and wine!

review.reviewText:
Wonderful place and atmosphere!
Your front desk was so helpful in planning our vacation!

review.title: Very good option
review.reviewText: Fast check in, very nice details on the room i hardly recommendnit to anybody gong to san Francisco
review.positiveRemarks: Near union square, good details, comfortable bed
review.negativeRemarks: Soundproofing the room, on friday night we could hear noise from the street
review.locationRemarks: Better imposible

review.title: GREAT location!
review.reviewText: Perfect location. Near all public transit. Very clean. Modern decor with old SF charm. Front desk staff AMAZINGLY HELPFUL! 2 restaurants attached: good food, higher end place. Bed was wonderful. In room nespresso maker great. Very attentive housekeeper. Highly recommend for adults; couples & business ppl. Prob not recommended for young children. Love the floors in room! No nasty carpet! 100% would stay here again!

review.title: Great hotel and staff
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location and the staff was wonderful.  We ate in the hotel restaurant twice and the food was really good.  Overall experience was lovely and will stay at Hotel G again.

Location is defenitively a plus! Staff could more friendly.. they could learn from the restaurant next door for example, that is great for breakfast. 

Look and feel + clean, another two important factors that you won't be disappointed.

Ps: watch out for the vallet parking as it costs a bit more than the advertised price due to the weird taxes!
Better lighting in the room would have Ben better.

review.title: Great hotel, good location
review.reviewText: My husband and I loved Hotel G! It was clean and very modern. The hotel staff was great and the bed was amazing! We will stay here again the next time we visit San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: I really liked the decor.

review.title: Great location!!
review.reviewText: I love this Hotel! It's in a fantastic location! The rooms are very comfortable and the bed and linens are dreamy. The only complaint I would have is lack of vanity space in the bathroom and the shower curtain is so flimsy it flies in and sticks to you when taking a shower. Other than that, it's great! The breakfast downstairs is to die for! I loved the shrimp and grits and the duck gravy over crispy hash browns is like heaven! The staff are very friendly, knowledgable and accommodating. I would highly recommend this hotel!!
review.negativeRemarks: Better shower curtains!

review.title: Excellent location and clean
review.reviewText: Everything was excellent.  Danny at the front desk was very helpful. Maria was very welcoming. Warm smiles when we arrived and during our stay. Perfect location. Room was nice and clean. Definitely would stay here again!

review.title: A taste of NYC in SF.
review.reviewText: Great hotel and great experience. In the heart of the city so it's very easy to get anywhere. I used Lyft car service to pick me up and it was a quick drive to all hotspots. The breakfast at the restaurant underneath the hotel was STELLAR. I went twice because it was so good.
review.positiveRemarks: It reminded me of New York City. The decor and the style of the hotel felt like an expensive New York City apartment.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel walls are a little thin, you could hear neighbors and footsteps in the halls. I am used to this because I live in New York City.
review.locationRemarks: TONS of shopping nearby. Quick walk to the Seaport.

review.title: Nice Staff
review.reviewText: The hotel was well kept. The staff is where this hotel shines. They were very nice and accommodating.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, decor and hotel staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed was very worn out and uncomfortable, but I wasn't in the room often so I did not complain. The only  you can hear everything in the hallways.
review.locationRemarks: It's right next to union square, a great location for tourist. It's also a couple of blocks away from the Powell BART station so it's easy to get to.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText:
There was only one working elevator the day we got there and in any other city, climbing stairs to the 5th floor wouldn't be so bad but after walking the hill of San Fran, climbing the stairs was torture. The second day both elevators were out and they did have maintenance working on it. I think my only complaint was that they didn't seem phased by the elevator being out of order. 
Hotel and room were clean. We turned the fan on and night and that drowned out the city noise. The hotel is in the center of Union Square with plenty of restaurants around. We took uber around to fisherman's warf, golden gate park, AT&T park, since we were in the center, no ride was too long or cost too much.

review.title: Right in the midle of action!
review.reviewText: Very good. Don't go sleep early!  Good for long weekend stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Vicinity of sites to be seen and places to be visited.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise level.
review.locationRemarks: Pretty bussy place! If you are in the action mood it's great!

review.title: Great location, tons of charm.
review.reviewText: Hotel G is located right in the heart of Union Square. Its got a ton of character, and really great staff. Look forward to going back the next time I go to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Hip vibe, great people, great restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: The second elevator was not working, but I wasn't really in a rush to get in or out of the building.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square has some great shopping, and everything is walking distance from the hotel.

review.title: Great boutique hotel in Union Sq.
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed here March 24-27. Staff was friendly, check in/out was a breeze. The location was very convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: The industrial feel of the hotel was great. Definitely a stand-out from the other chain hotels in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: One elevator was out of service my whole stay, so that was a little annoying. The rooms were definitely smaller than pictured.
review.locationRemarks: Close to public transportation, shopping and food. Hotel was on the cutoff between the nice part of Union Square and the shadier part one block south.

review.title: Nice hotel in the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText:
Excellent hotel that you can walk to union square from in 2 minutes! Close to the cable cars and lots of good restaurants and shopping. Obviously this building has been renovated but it is super trendy and very clean!
Would go back in a heartbeat!
review.positiveRemarks: Very nice
review.negativeRemarks: The walls are a little thin
review.locationRemarks:
Union Square close
Cable cars
Easy to access Fisherman's Wharf, all the other tourist stuff

review.title: Modern hotel at Union Square.
review.reviewText:
Great location, check in was very smooth, room was nice, modern design. 

Unfortunately due to concrete floors it was very noisy, every time someone entered the floor... Carpets in the hallway would make it so much better!!!

review.title: Great hotel, central to everything
review.reviewText: Loved our stay at Hotel G. Great room, brilliant location near Union Square
We had a very nice time in the city and our hotel was convenient location to our needs and it was clean and roomy for a big city hotel room

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location, very safe with easy access to the BART And shopping.  It was clean and the beds were comfy.  David J checked us in and he was the best!!!  We loved David!  Overall, very pleased with the hotel and staff.

review.title: Friendliest staff ever!
review.reviewText: I never gush, but we loved this hotel! It's in a great location with easy access to buses, cable car/trolley routes, BART, shopping, galleries and dining. We appreciated the restoration decor and finishes, and although we'd booked the smallest room, it was still comfortable and we slept great. The front desk accommodated our early check in and late check out. I have to commend the housekeeping and maintenance staff in particular. Maintenance responded immediately to a problem with our safe, and the two housekeepers we met coming and going were exceptionally friendly and always helpful--and they kept our room immaculate.

love the decor! vintage details....amazing and friendly staff 
great location, near union square...nice restaurants around
review.positiveRemarks: love the decor! vintage details....amazing and friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: temperature of water
review.locationRemarks: great location, near union square...nice restaurants around

review.title: Nice hotel good location
review.reviewText: The facilities and room was clean and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the price and everything was clean and comfortable.  Good location.
review.negativeRemarks: Add a nice comfy chair to the room.
review.locationRemarks: It is centrally located easy walk to Westfield mall, Chinatown, trolley car, Hop on Hop off buses.

review.title: Wonderful hotel, great location, fine finishings
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel, great staff, fine finishings, great location. Couldn't ask for anything more. Great value.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything
review.negativeRemarks: The views I suppose, but we were never in our room long enough to really care.
review.locationRemarks: One block away from union square. Perfect downtown location. Can walk to the shops, many restaurants and many sights.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Staff was outstanding, location 1 block from Union Square, lots of restaurant choices. No need for a rental car.

review.title: Walls were soooo thin.
review.reviewText: Woman in next room coughing kept me up all night. Even though I paid for two nights, I only stayed for one.

review.title: Weekend stay
review.reviewText: The bed was a little too firm and they didn't say that we had to pay extra for parking either $45 per day or find a public parking which is always full around that area

review.title: Funky boutique hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel G for 5 nights in mid February,  the hotel is located a couple of blocks from Union Square, great location.  Lots of different kinds of tranportation to take you to the waterfront (trolley $6.00 per ride, streetcar $2.25 and bus)  Room was clean and a nice size for the two of us.  Would have liked a couch in the room, it would have been more comfortable then the 2 chairs provided.  Lighting in the bathroom could definitely be better.  The king size bed was very comfortable (Room 402) corner room. Staff at the hotel were very friendly and accommodating,  it was our 40th Wedding Anniversary and they upgraded our hotel room. Try the diner across the street, I believe it was called Pinewood, great service and good food.  I was disappointed with the Klyd Cafe in the Hotel,  a coffee cost me $3.50 US and they had no cream, whats up with that????, their a coffee shop.  Did not go back. There was an expresso machine in the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to downtown was perfect.  Small hotel, only 103 rooms.  Rooms nicely decorated.  Staff very friendly. Room price was reasonable.
review.negativeRemarks: Lighting in the bathroom could be improved.  A couch in room rather then chairs.
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect for us, lots of restaurants, pubs  and shopping very close by.  Waterfront was just a streetcar ride away.

review.title: Great city centre hotel
review.reviewText: Boutique experience in the city centre.  Helpful staff and comfy beds.

review.title: Minimalist on Union Square
review.reviewText: The staff was just lovely, and the hotel is simple and perfect for those looking for a clean, unfussy space in a great location. Beds were very comfortable, amenities were right on, the staff was very helpful and friendly, the attached Klyde restaurant was nice but a bit overpriced.
review.negativeRemarks: Walls are a bit thin, you can hear loud people in the hallway, cooling unit was a bit loud too. The bathroom could use another shelf or table/stand.

review.title: Good modern looking interior hotel for the price.
review.reviewText: Went to San Francisco for business. Didn't spend much time at the hotel but every night I came back from running around the city the room was spotless; bed was made, bathroom was clean, coffee pods (for the nespresso) were restocked. No complain about the staff, except they charged me for a san pellegrino I did not consume from the nini fridge (not a big deal). The room safe was nice to have to keep my laptop safe when I was away.
review.positiveRemarks: Modern renovated look.
review.locationRemarks: Location was a little sketchy, homeless people everywhere. But, it is located in the heart of downtown San Francisco, so everything is near by.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel...bed was comfy but the sitting furniture was very uncomfortable.  Also did not like that there was not any room at all in the bathroom for toiletries.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was sparkling clean everyday, front desk guys were helpful and very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: more comfortable sitting furniture.......
review.locationRemarks: close to Union Square, shuttle and bus pickups.  And across from the best restaurant ever...Daily's.

very clean

review.positiveRemarks: staff, Klyde restaurant, cool design

review.locationRemarks: good central location

review.title: Great boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Great boutique hotel with nice simple styling - attached to a nice breakfast place, which is convenient. And also a fairly new, clean gym.
Everything was excellent,couldn't complain if I tried.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, cool interior, nice staff, great restaurants, nice rooms.

review.title: Nice hotel, in the middle of Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, Staff were attentive and helpful. I booked for a night as I was in SF for a business trip. The bed was comfortable and I slept well. I was on a higher floor so I was not bothered by outside noise. Driving by, you will miss it as there is no large signage outside the hotel. The name is on the door, but its easy to miss. Not crazy about the $45 for valet parking but there is no real parking anywhere around the hotel. I did enjoy the hotel and would stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel was comfortable and trendy. Room was a good size, but for the "Greatest King" I thought it would be a little bigger, but it was not a problem.

review.title: Meh
review.reviewText: Lobby and elevators looked like they were under construction but room was nice. Bed was a little small though supposed to be queen but pretty sure it was a full.
review.locationRemarks: Can't beat the location if your want Union square

review.title: Small but clean
review.reviewText:
Small but clean rooms
Old hotel but modern items in room (tv etc)

review.title: Good location for Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice place. Rooms are small but clean, which is all you really want. Wood floors creak, but I was up so early it didn't matter to me. First hotel I have ever stayed in that had reasonable rates for the in-room snacks and drinks.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping and a short walk from the convention center.

review.title: Retro Hotel
review.reviewText: If you're looking for the Ritz this isn't your hotel but if you are looking for a clean, retro looking hotel in the middle of union square for a reasonable price this is the hotel for you.  The lobby is a bit deceiving (again it's an older, retro type hotel) but the staff and the rooms are great.  Very clean, exceptional staff and very comfortable bed.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was wonderful!
review.negativeRemarks: Would like more hooks or shelving in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.  Close to cable cars, tour buses, shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Best hotel at union square
review.reviewText: Always great service. Great staff. Great rooms. Only hotel we stay at in San Francisco.

review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.reviewText: Great hotel and great location. I also love the restaurant next to the hotel. But I recommend couples to live in this hotel, because the atmosphere is really romantic. So it's kind of weird for business trip or friends' trip.

review.title: Great hotel, funky fit out, excellent staff, great
review.reviewText: Great location, the most comfortable beds I've slept in, funky fit out, really helpful staff, overall a perfect place to stay to explore San fran. If only they were all like this

review.title: Great hotel, great location!
review.reviewText:
Stayed on the 10th floor, absolutely loved the room and the modern industrial furnishings! 

Only comment is that the rooms are not sound proof from the internal corrodors or other rooms.
Very Central and in the Good area of Union Square. Macy's one block away.

Great location access to shops and good food. Close to hotel you are able to access ground transportation BART/ trolly/ bus. Hotel clean and staff will hold luggage until it's time to check in if you arrive early.

review.title: Very nice in Union Square area of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very nice location and convienant valet parking that helped out a ton with the busy streets.
I booked a tour but the staff did not inform me I needed to come down an hour earlier

review.title: Great and stylish hotel in Union square
review.reviewText: Loved our stay here! The beds were comfy, the staff was very friendly, the room was stylish and the nesspresso machine was great.  Best of all, the location was really convenient for shopping, hopping on the cable car, etc.  We loved it here so much that we stayed here 2x in a week (we live in the Bay Area.)

review.title: Nice  hotel  great  location
review.reviewText:
Had such a lovely time  in this  hotel  the room  was great n the location  of the  hotel was fantastic, it was in  walking  distance  of off the shop's. The  room was clean  and the Internet  was really  fast.
I would  stay  here.
Please  go to the restaurant  across  the  road  they have  the best breakfast  in san francisco

review.title: Xmas trip.
review.reviewText: Great location. Good value for money. Hotel is a little shabby.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square

review.title: Quirky but comfortable
review.reviewText: I was there for an annual conference. The decor shows old exposed details of a previous establishment so the effect is deliberately rough around the edges. The room grew on me. After a couple of days it felt homey; furnishings were comfortable in a modern style with antique details. My room facing Geary was quiet enough until the end of the week where the street life got pretty noisy. I'd recommend the hotel to a friend but with reservations. The place is conveniently situated.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed comfortable, good internet, well equipped little exercise room.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor a bit off putting at first. Lobby really uninspired. Rooms facing Geary somewhat noisy.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square/Powell Street.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Location is great as far as being in Union square with its proximity to all the nice stores/restaurant.  The hotel itself has lots of character with the owners doing a great job with restoring the building and the individual rooms. Unfortunately, the hotel is located next to a night club (Ruby Skye) and it gets loud and stays loud throughout the night. In addition, being in the downtown area means lots of traffic and constant honking until the about 2:30 a.m.  If noise is going to be an issue, I suggest bringing ear plugs. All that being said, it's nice that there is a delicious and reasonably priced restaurant connected to the hotel and that the car rental companies are located right around the corner.  Also, the Westfield mall and access to the BART is a 4 block (downhill) walk.

review.title: Right in the Heart of the San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Cool retro kind of hotel with large quiet rooms.  Fast check-in.
review.positiveRemarks: Had a nice vibe to it - everyone was friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, BART, Financial District, tons of restaurants.

review.title: make up on old apartment
review.reviewText: this place is close to the union square which is a plus and explains the price. However, the rooms are old apartment building rooms that have been painted and given an brush up. It is ok place to stay while visiting union square area. But, my main complaint is the ridiculously poor lighting in the room. The room has four light fixtures but the ones above the office table and next to bed has bulb equivalent to 40 W or lower. These were too dim for reading or any activity requiring sharp eye. I brought this to the attention of the front desk where the person shrugged it off as unfounded complaint. Eventually he agreed to bring it to the manager. So, my advice is that if you plan on reading in the room this may not be the place for you. The TV is nice, I liked it. The radio clock is weird and unusual and it took me some 5 minutes to set the alarm. Not the most user friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Union square
review.negativeRemarks: the lights in the room and the alarm clock

review.title: Comfortable Hotel with a Nice Contemporary Look
review.reviewText: Liked the decor, nice big TV and roomy bathroom. Motion-detector on the bathroom light was a nice touch.
review.negativeRemarks: Better outdoor signage - walked past it twice before finding it.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near Union Square and Market St.

review.reviewText: Hotel was fine, nice enough place to stay the front desk is a bit of an akward set up but over all a nice place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Seems to be under construction but not really under construction, the front desk is akward.

review.title: Liked it, didn't love it.
review.reviewText: Overall, the hotel is a great place.  The staff was wonderful.  The main things that I was unhappy about was the lighting in our room.  Very dim and dreary.  And if someone wanted to put on some make-up, that is very challenging.  Also, the bathroom needs more surface space for personal belongings.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, noise level (it was pretty quiet), the staff was very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The lighting needs to be reconsidered. Perhaps a few hooks, etc. for hanging clothing.  The two staggering hooks are not user friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, just a bit hectic for the valet service with the holiday activites and the protests going on when we were there.

review.title: Hip reasonable boutique hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Smart room, well appointed, comfy bed. Only drawback is that there seems to be very little insulation from hallway noise. (Hardwood floors throughout) Unless you're a light sleeper, this is a great hotel.

review.title: Fantastic hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Great location, right next to Union Square. Lovely comfortable and clean rooms. Stay here!

review.title: Fantastic Hotel in Central San Fran
review.reviewText: An old hotel that makes the most of that while creating a modern feel. Staff cool, laid back but very helpful. Central location is great. A fantastic break from the soulless feel of major hotel chains.  Will go back next time I'm in San Francisco.

review.title: Very Noisy Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel.....BUT.....I was on the 6th floor and could hear traffic and people out on the street. But even worse, I could clearly hear the guy in the next room and anybody in the hall! Way too noisy for hotel. Very disappointed.
Nice enough, but still being renovated. The rooms are spacious and the bed was comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location.
review.negativeRemarks: Still being renovated.

review.reviewText: Great place to stay. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms neat and clean. Also great in house restaurant.

review.title: SF for two nights for two

Not too expensive either considering the room size and location. Shuttle service is super convenient as well. Thanks Hotel G!!

review.title: Great Location

review.positiveRemarks: Spacious room, very nice decor.

review.title: Stylish Stay

I have a background in fashion and interior design and travel for business frequently- I consider myself a discerning hotel guest.
This was my second stay at Hotel G and I have already booked my next stay here!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, stylish aesthetic.  Beautiful furnishings, natural light, great bedding (I'm in the luxury linen business!).
review.negativeRemarks: As an old building, the sound proofing is not the best- I could hear hallway traffic.
review.locationRemarks: Heart of Union Square- best place to eat and shop San Franciscan style!

review.reviewText: Very small rooms....very old property....staff very friendly, but they can only do so much with this property

review.title: Great location for my needs

It was a perfect space for me to come back and collect my thoughts before going out to the multitude of options for dining and entertainment In the Bay Area.  Easy access to Powell St BART or the more old fashioned ride on The trolley or even the ferry.  I found it an ideal launching point and home base. dont overlook Klydes right downstairs off the lobby entrance!

review.title: Good Stay, Great Location, Great Food
review.reviewText: The Staff is very friendly and accomodating. The rooms are clean, spacious, new. The restaurant downstairs is excellent. There isn't noise pollution from outside, but you can hear the guest in their rooms. If the rooms were more soundproof I would give it 4 Stars. I give it 3.5. Privacy is an issue.  If you are going to put all that money into revamping the place, sound proof the rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, decor, restaurant, staff
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proof the rooms

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed 5 nights. Hotel room was very modern and strange at first, had to live out of suitcase no dresser to put our clothes in. Got a great price on Expedia. Hotel has not had Grand opening so wondering if after Grand opening if the price skyrockets it might not be worth it, but had a great experience. Clean Hotel would recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: fantastic bed, great location close to Cable car/Bart Station
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom is extremely small has no room to put anything,needs more shelf room. Closet was strange had no doors. No dresser to put any clothes.

review.reviewText: Nice hotel close to everything. The rooms were great.

review.title: Nice modern hotel in central of town
review.reviewText: Modern and beautifully styled large rooms. Staff are very helpful and knowledgeable. Restaurant attached to the hotel serves gourmet breakfast, lunch and dinner. Imagine: bacon wrapped prawns with grits and poached eggs or crab cakes with Harissa infused hollandaise with perfectly poached eggs for breakfast. Even if super gourmet it was very affordable. Yum!

review.title: Excellent staff, great location next to Union  Sq
review.reviewText:
Old in process of renovation, superb staff, especially David. Very green and simple. 
Location unbelieveable, very clean and modestly furnished. Wifi, safe new bathrooms and beds.  Great value; highly recommend.

review.title: Great location, great staff and great rooms
review.reviewText:
Cool but comfortable retro feel to the rooms.  Loved the exposed concrete floors and  old trim combined with classic furnishings - gives the rooms a modern but 'homey' feel. 

Still some ongoing construction but it didn't interfere with our stay at all - no construction noise. Looks like everything should be completed shortly. 

The staff were great. Helpful and friendly.  The hotel was very quite and didn't seem crowded - despite SFO hosting the World Series the week we were there. 

I would highly recommend this hotel if you enjoy botique hotels like we do.

Overall it was a good experience. The one issue I had was the price of parking.  For the cost of the room you would think parking would be included but its not.  $65 for a small SUV and $45 for a normal sized car reminds me of the air lines charging for peanuts.

review.title: Bright future
review.reviewText: Not the best for business travelers.  Perhaps with the finishing touches might be better.  Staff was ok. Great location. New hotel.

review.title: Great location and friendly staff
review.reviewText: Loved the location and the beautiful room.  We had great views, and beautiful large windows that allowed for tons of natural California light to stream in.
review.locationRemarks: Located in the middle of Union Square with shopping and art galleries galore.  Close to AT&T park, Fisherman's Wharf and Nob Hill.

review.title: SF trip
review.reviewText: Super close to union square and cable car ride. Staff was nice and pleasant. I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to union square

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Located right next to Union Square, this quaint hotel is full of charm.  While the floors are spectacular, it's obvious they are still renovating.  Looking forward to seeing what the final results are.

review.title: Horrid.
review.reviewText: I'm not even going to write bc I wrote 2 reviews that got cancelled, I didn't use any bad language. So here is a short one. It was bad and I would never stay they again, nor would I ever use Expedia again.

review.title: Nice hotel centrally located
review.reviewText: The staff was excellent room clean and meet there in the process of a lot of refurbishing the rooms are done some work needs to be done on the lobby but I'm sure overtime this will turn into an excellent value

review.title: Not Ready for Primetime
review.reviewText: It still is a work in progress.  They seem to be aiming at a downtown chic version of a "W" hotel, but right now, it borders on downtown shabby (e.g. elevators are very scruffy.   When I stepped into my room, it badly needed fresh air but I was locked out from opening windows, except in the bathroom.   The room is well appointed with minibar, robe, hair dryer, etc. but it was dark and dingy.   Could hear the neighbors through the wall.  The staff was first rate --- very, very nice and helpful.   There was a ceiling leak in my room and they jumped right on it, offered to move me, etc.  They're still constructing --- I'd give it a little more time.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff
review.negativeRemarks: Need to finish the construction.   Also, it would be nice to be able to open windows.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is the place for shopping, Powell Street cable car, BART station, etc. etc.   Also lots of bums.

review.title: Hotel without any facilities!
review.reviewText: No Bar,Restaurant or facilities,only bedrooms.Hotel frequently changes ownership and is a bit tired.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable rooms in a very good location
review.negativeRemarks: Price decrease and some facilities
review.locationRemarks: Lots to do in SF,a great city for all ages.

review.reviewText: Bar and gym were still being worked on.  Lobby is pretty spartan, but they more than make up for it with free beer and chips.  My room was a little on the small side but had very cool and comfy decor with wood floors and high ceiling.  Nice bed.  Not much of a view from my room.  This is a great option if you're getting it at a competitive rate.  Much more interesting than your Marriott, Hilton, etc.
Great room but the bathroom was really small. They could use a hook on the door in the bathroom. Great location and friendly staff. We will definitely stay again.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText:
Location was great!  Room had a musty smell, but bed was comfy & room was cute. Once the renos are done it will be better.
You could hear the conversation of the people in the next room quite clearly!
review.negativeRemarks: The musty smell of the rooms.

review.title: Not quite what the website promised
review.reviewText: Still under renovation, Hotel G does not currently have any on-site food or beverage service.  Neither is there a workout center. If you go knowing these things (their absence is not clear on their website), then you'll enjoy your visit.  The room was exceptionally large and well-appointed.  My room faced a busy street, so there was traffic noise.  One wonders why hotels don't invest in noise reduction windows during such an extensive renovation. Overall, I'd rate it pleasing.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Had a great stay at hotel G. Location cannot be beat. It was even closer to Union Square than I thought. Everything is right at your fingertips, in a nice location with lovely art galleries all around. We stayed 6 nights and the hotel was so great that they upgraded our room complimentary. Things are still under renovation but you can see the potential.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was amazing, sooo comfortable. The bed was probably the best part of the room.
review.negativeRemarks: It was pretty noisy in the hallway and you could hear everything. Maybe a carpet would fix this?
review.locationRemarks: Union square right outside. Hop on Hop off buses are right there. All the shopping is steps away. Some really nice high end art galleries next door.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: A central location with easy access to all attractions. Good staff, stylish rooms and old San Fran ambience.

Very nice hotel except for the small bathroom.
"Trendy" with a lot of younger travelers.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The renovation has left bare concrete floors.  I think they should carpet them.
review.locationRemarks: Center of the city so everything.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Very good location. staff are friendly and helpful.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText:
Hotel G has recently been refitted, with a rather funky interior. The rooms themselves were beautifully decorated, although there were some very modern touches such as exposed concrete floors with rugs. I rather liked the new decor, but it may potentially be a little modern for some guests. 

The location was great and the staff could not have been more helpful. However, one thing to flag which will affect all hotels around Union Square is that there are a lot of homeless people. Clearly nothing that can Hotel G can take any responsibility for, but rather something to bear in mind when selecting anywhere in the area. 

Overall, I very much enjoyed my stay in Hotel G and would highly recommend it for anyone with modern tastes who wants God connections to the rest of San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel, too bad about the noise
review.reviewText:
Was not impressed by this hotel. It is in a great location, but for the prices they charge I expected a much better experience

Pros:
- Good location for tourists next to union square
- Cool decor and urban feel
- Nescafe machine in your room, big tv

Cons:
- We were placed in a room next to the elevator. This hotel has very thin walls because you can hear lots of noise and creaking and you can actually feel the wall shake when the elevator operates. In my opinion the rooms next to the elevator should not even be guest rooms with all the noise that occurs. You can also hear people walking through the hallways very clearly, it feels like there is no soundproofing at all
- The air conditioning is incredibly loud, you would want to turn it off while sleeping
- The room is tiny. There is hardly enough space for two people. The bathroom does not have any space near the sink to place your toiletries
- No cell reception in the rooms (T-mobile)

The only thing really going for this hotel is the location. However, if you want a decent nights sleep, avoid this hotel. No amount of polishing the proverbial turd will make up for the structural issues with the rooms. With the westin just next door with rooms at similar rates I can see no reason to recommend Hotel G
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, cool decor
review.negativeRemarks: THE NOISE. Rooms are too small. Too expensive for what it offers
review.locationRemarks: Next to union square so good central location for tourists

review.title: Under construction
review.reviewText:
Not told when we booked that they were remodeling.  No carpets on floor in hallways or rooms. We were told that is the look they were going for. Industrial look!
Elevator was shabby, loose wires and cracked light fixtures
review.positiveRemarks: Very helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: Flooring and elevators

review.title: Great location and super accomodating staff !
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here on a weekend, while attending a Giants game.  I gave the hotel a 3 on condition of it, because it IS under construction, although, no work was being done while we were there :)  This hotel is chic, and centrally located.  We were able to walk to the game from the hotel, and its 2 minutes from Union Square, which has several shopping stores, along with great restaurants.  Lori's Diner, is across the street from this hotel, and they have a fabulous breakfast !  I also loved this hotel, because they let us check in 3 hours early, so we could put our stuff away, before heading to the game.  I had left something in my car, that I wanted, and the staff had someone go and get it out of my car, and bring it to my room ! Againl, very nice hotel with exceptional staff !
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location
review.negativeRemarks: They are in the process of making improvements :)
review.locationRemarks: Much like I said before, this hotel is in a great location....close to everything !

review.title: Great city stay
review.reviewText: A fantastic hotel, right next to Union Square! Very 'Shoreditch' and very cool.  The staff were very lovely and we were upgraded to a Queen room as we mentioned it was our honeymoon. Would definitely go back again, and already have friends staying there when they visit later this year.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor was great, and the staff were so friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: The front of the hotel was still being completed, which we already knew, but that is the only thing.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great.  2 minute walk from Union Square, Cheesecake Factory is 3 minutes away in Macy's and great transport links to Fisherman's What

review.title: Very nice rooms
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the experience. Would stay again. Great rooms and service

review.title: Great location. Loved the quaintness of the hotel.
review.reviewText: We had a larger king sized room which Very nice, clean and spacious. Hotel staff are great. Slow elevators, but that is to be expected in an older building. It didn't bother us. My only complaint would be that the sinks in the bathrooms are very small. You can't wash your face off or brush your teeth without getting water all over the floor. The espresso machine in the room was wonderful to have. The black out drapes work great. Minimalistic, but at the same time they thought of everything. I would stay here again.

review.title: Nice but no sound insulation between the rooms
review.reviewText: Hotel is nicely designed and staff are friendly and helpful, but there was a connecting door to the room next door and absolutely no sound insulation. You could hear everything next door - conversations word for word, TV, people moving around, etc. So it was noisy and you had zero privacy (presumably they could hear everything in your room too). Plus, the room had a desk but was difficult to work in because the lighting was so low.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: I loved hotel g. The only issue was the floor in parts creaked a little. But I was comfortable. My bed was big and comfy. I just loved it. Great location too.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location- 5 mins from Union sq, room small as expected in big city but not cramped, bed very comfy. We were on 4th floor but double windows so very little street noise. Had everything we wanted

review.title: The hotel is centrally located.
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located  near China Town, Union Square,  downtown ( Market St) and the cable cars to North Beach and Fisherman's Wharf. There is handy shopping ( Macy's, Levi's, Old navy, and the more expensive Saks, Nordstrom, Tiffany ) and restaurants of all kinds. The hotel staff is pleasant, helpful and warm. The price was competitive to its neighbors. The hotel will be even better when it is completed.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very friendly and helpful, accommodating our needs.  The bed was comfortable and the view was good.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel was under construction and that was a little disturbing.  There was no bathtub and the shower was partially enclosed and therefore cold.
review.locationRemarks: China Town , first rate shopping and multinational dining are near by.  Cable cars and buses going everywhere are available.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Just one block away from Union Square. Near transport and amenities. Walkable location to every shopping area in town. The room was just a little eerie when we entered considering there wasn't much sunlight and the window views were blocked by the building next door. Room could do with more lighting but was spacious and very clean. Complimentary bottles of water were very much appreciated as water isn't cheap in US.

review.negativeRemarks: lighting/ view of the room.

review.title: Friends Wedding in town
review.reviewText: Visited town for a friends wedding so needed to spend 3 days in total catching up and also seeing San Francisco for the 1st time. Found Hotel G online and loved the website, and general feel of the Hotel. Was very much surprised at the outstanding location - just 1 minute to Union square. Rooms are brand new (refurbed) and really like the modern approach to the design with the amenities more than most established 5 star hotels in the area. The highlight was the service team from engineering to front desk to Hotel Manager after we left the hotel and arrived home. Accommodating, friendly, and felt like coming back home when we arrive back. Reasonably knowledgeable of the local area

Nespresso machine - and also one in the lobby
Simple, clean, and neat communication in the room
Location, Location

Room/breakfast service would have been a great addition, but there are so many great diners outside the front door, it's not essential.  I will definitely be staying again.

review.title: Has a long way to be rated 4 star
review.reviewText:
, the hotel facility is very poor. One of our worst hotel stay experiences.
·         We were told it is a renovated hotel, yet, it is being renovated or rather patched up! We felt like being on a building site not a hotel.
·         The room is dull and smelly. Not enough lighting. You cannot sit and read in the room, while there’s no lobby where one can sit and read or relax, as it is the case in other four star hotels (Hotel G is marketed as a four stars hotel, I wouldn’t rate it even three stars).
·         The room lock is faulty. The staff tried to replace the key few times but still we always had a difficulty opening the door trying the key few times, but we just put up with it.
·         Where is in this century, one cannot find a computer room to print a document? Certainly at the unique hotel G in San Francisco!
·         No restaurant in this four stars hotel!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel in Perfect Location
review.reviewText: We just stayed at Hotel G with my husband for a few nights. The hotel is located just a block from Union Square which is a perfect location. It is an upscale area with lots of commercial options for shopping and food. Extremely convenient for public transportation and the cable car and street car routes. For us, this is a much better option that the tourist trap areas around Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. The hotel itself is still under renovation but it did not bother us at all. We never heard construction noises and the room was perfectly in order and finished. The bed is super comfortable and so is the bathroom. We really felt very comfortable overall, in the room and with the personnel which was absolutely wonderful in all regards. Remember you are in a big city though so you will hear some traffic passing by (not terrible though), but this is a city :) We would definitely stay there again!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, comfort, people/employees
review.negativeRemarks: Since they are renovating, the cafe and restaurant was not open yet

I would not go back.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
Thought Hotel G was really good. I loved that we were the first ones to stay in our room as the hotel is so new. My only complaint is that the room is a bit noisy. Not the noise from the street, but from the hall way. Since there is no carpet, noise seems to travel more.
Location was prefect for us near Union Square.

review.reviewText:
Great location within walking distance of everything in Union Square. Easily took public transportation to other locations.  The room was a bit small, bed was cozy, light was a little too dim for me, no couch, floors were cleaned but scuffed up, and night was noisy (but I guess that goes with being in the downtown area). 
 
Upon checking in - I was hit with a 400.00 fee (100.00 per night incidental fee) in advance. Usually with any other hotel, I leave my credit card on file for this, but this time, they wanted to charge me a pending fee, which held up 400.00 of my spending money. I was not too pleased at all. 

I think the price of the hotel is too expensive. There is not a gym or pool, or much to do within the hotel itself. The room rate needs to decrease  or the hotel needs to expand. 

Did not really speak to hotel staff much, but when I did they were ok.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great. A lot of trendy spots to eat. Union Square park is right up the block, and the MUNI system public transportation is close by.
review.negativeRemarks: The floors are so scuffed up, it made me think twice about checking in. I understand it's an old hotel, but the website makes it seem very modern.

review.title: Wonderful new alternative in the heart of SF
review.reviewText:
Although I was a bit leery of booking a hotel without any reviews, I was also excited to try a new place, so I decided to make a booking at what was a very low rate for this area. Upon arriving at the hotel, any concerns I had were laid to rest. The staff was very friendly and efficient, and the hotel was only a short walk from the Powell Street BART/Muni station. My room on the 10th floor had a magnificent view of the neighborhood, and the room itself was incredibly large by any hotel standard, especially for an older building in SF. In my many visits to the area, I have stayed in at least half a dozen comparable hotels within a mile of here, and this was easily the largest room I have had in the city.

In addition to a very comfortable bed topped with an adorable yellow California decorative pillow, the room also has a very comfortable couch and a large Samsung smart tv that pivoted for viewing from the bed or the living area. The room also comes with a Tivoli alarm clock/radio that has bluetooth for easy wireless connections to a phone or computer, and a Nespresso machine. The walk-in closet was also one of the largest I have seen in a hotel room, with ample room to store luggage and clothes. The hotel does not have any sort of restaurant or bar, but there are seemingly hundreds of these within a very short walk, and at least six breakfast places within a two block walk in any direction.
review.positiveRemarks: location, size and amenities of room
review.locationRemarks: dozens of restaurants of all kinds within a 5 minute walk, plenty of shopping along Powell and Market, a block from cable car and 3 blocks from BART

The only thing I would say is that the walls are thin and without carpet in the rooms or hallways, it can be a little noisy. We still loved the vibe of the place and would definitely use it again and would recommend it to others.

review.title: No carpet
review.reviewText:
Hotel is NOT under renovation according to front desk. There is no carpet by design.

No carpet in rooms or hall ways. Cracked concrete floors.

Mismatched furniture from flea market. Certainly did not have furniture shown in Expedia Web Site picture.
Tiny bath room no vanity for make up application. Lighting poor in bathroom.

Fire alarm system works as wake up call at 7 am.

$300 hold on credit card for "incidentals"

Plus
Fluffy towels and pillows, nice bedding. They provided slippers to keep feet warm on bare concrete.
Easy to get around downtown San Francisco
review.positiveRemarks: Location and Price
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: Dissapointed
review.reviewText:
After searching for a hotel in Union Square I came across the website for Hotel G. It looked very "W" like and they were running a special so thought I would try it out. I arrived and made my way to what they call the front desk, acutally two tiny little work stations. I check in and when I went to the room I was shocked at how small it was but thought I was by myself and its ony two nights. The room smelled very musty, almost like mildew. It was decorated to try and look chic, W style but came off a bit bare. The bathroom was updated but so dark you could hardly see in the mirrow. When I put the airconditioner on the smell really came on stronger. The room was so small and stuffy you had to have it on. Also it was so loud that you couldn't hear the TV with it on. One more problem was that the bed frame was so close to the desk you hit your shin on it everytime you went to mess with the airconditioner. This hotel has zero amenities. The in-room "expresso" machine made luke warm coffee.

The first morning there a fire alarm went off at 6am and everyone had to go downstairs, only to be told it was a false alarm....couldn't they announce it over the loud speaker like they did to tell us to get out? Second morning the phone rang at 4:30am with awake up call (which I didn't order) and yes cracked my shin AGAIN trying to get ot the phone on the desk. Also very noisy, with wood/concret floors and roller bags.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean out your airconditioners, get rid of the meildew. Maybe put a carpet runner down halls so you don't hear everyone coming and going.
review.locationRemarks: All the stores and restaurants in Union Square. Very well located to everything.
